fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • In an interview with the climate campaigner Greta Thunberg, we incorrectly said “people with selective mutism typically do not suffer from an inability to talk”. As the NHS notes, selective mutism is a “severe anxiety disorder where a person is unable to speak in certain social situations … They’re literally unable to speak” (‘I was always that girl at the back who doesn’t say anything’, 11 March, page 8, G2). • Other recently corrected articles include: Closing credits: the battle to save 1930s Odeon cinemas – photo essay ‘My God, the Germans suffered’: Jason Clarke on sex, war crimes and Brexit ‘Justice is bought’: Paul Manafort sentencing draws accusations of privilege
